location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from James Morley, East India Company Resident at Bushire, and his assistant, George Green, to Thomas Hodges, President and Governor at Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter reports that, due to no Persian troops yet arriving at the coast, the Bombay,the Essex,and the Wolfhave sailed for Bombay. It states that when George Skipp returns from Schyrass [Shiraz] they will begin withdrawing stock from Bushire. Also given is the latest news about the loss of an English vessel off Hallela [Heleylah].
